entry.title: Respect user eligibility in holding space wallpaper nudge experiment.
entry.content:
Previously, the holding space wallpaper nudge experiment wouldn't show

the nudge to ineligible users, but it would still show wallpaper

highlights and support the new wallpaper drop target to pin files to

holding space.



This CL fixes the experiment so that ineligible users will see no

behavioral changes at all, even when the experiment is enabled.



Note that this CL also fixes some metric related tests.



Bug: b:325646627

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Block non-PDF navigation attempts on PDF frames
entry.content:
Block navigation attempts on PDF frames that aren't relevant for PDF

viewer setup by blocking the request in PdfNavigationThrottle. That way,

compromised renderers won't be able to navigate the PDF frames.



To avoid a dependency violation, PdfNavigationThrottle (which lives in

//components/pdf) uses a new ShouldCancelPdfFrameNavigation() function

in PdfStreamDelegate that ChromePdfStreamDelegate (which lives in

//chrome/browser/pdf) overrides to block these navigations.



Bug: 40286700

Change-Id: I988b31471e934989212206e425cd440ebc0281bd

entry.title: Reland "webnn: Remove sync methods"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a3e84dde09e099bebbe4793ffaa70679168130d6



This CL contains a few additional changes:

- Enables the async APIs on workers, which was causing bots to fail

since workers could not call createContext()

- Rebaselines WPTs accordingly

- Updates the WPT expectations for the webnn-service-enabled virtual

test suite



Original change's description:

> webnn: Remove sync methods

>

> See https://github.com/webmachinelearning/webnn/pull/548

>

> Deletes all sync methods and simplifies the names of all "Async"

> methods - e.g. BuildAsync() -> Build()

>

entry.title: Implement click and aria-pressed for NTP's Wallpaper Search Button
entry.content:
- Adds click behavior + updates relevant metrics

- Adds aria-pressed behavior



* Hiding the button for users who don't have wallpaper search setting

turned on will happen in another CL.



Click behavior works in tandem with the Customize Chrome button.



User journeys for clicking Wallpaper Search button:

- Side panel is closed -> Opens Wallpaper search

- Side panel is open to non Wallpaper Search page

-> Opens Wallpaper search

- Side panel is open to Wallpaper Search

-> Closes side panel

entry.title: Fix bug in which holding space tray/bubble were not being hidden.
entry.content:
When the holding space wallpaper nudge experiment is enabled, the

holding space tray will be force shown if a help bubble is anchored to

it. When the holding space bubble is opened, the help bubble is closed.

Previously, if the user were to then empty their holding space, the

scoped object causing the force shown behavior would result in the

holding space tray/bubble not being hidden. This CL fixes that.

entry.title: Add new holding space wallpaper nudge experiment arm.
entry.content:
Previous arms were:



(1) Counterfactual

(2) Enabled w/o drop-to-pin on wallpaper

(3) Enabled w/ drop-to-pin on wallpaper w/ auto-open of Tote



This CL adds a new arm:



(4) Enabled w/ drop-to-pin on wallpaper but w/o auto-open of Tote



This new arm (4) will compete primarily against existing arm (3) to

ascertain whether auto-opening Tote when a user pins a file via dropping

it on the wallpaper is beneficial or obnoxious.



Bug: b:274659315

Change-Id: I7300232bd4282e78796f54bb5a9b5c7e4ead506f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5302273

Commit-Queue: David Black

Reviewed-by: Toni Barzic

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1262037}

entry.title: Add time bucket versions of user education interaction histograms.
entry.content:
Both the Welcome Tour and the holding space wallpaper nudge experiments

record time based metrics when the user performs important interactions.

The times recorded are high fidelity (ms) which makes them very accurate

but difficult for non-technical folks to read.



To make it easier for non-technical folks to read these interaction

metrics, this CL introduces high readability versions of the existing

metrics which are based on predefined time buckets.



Bug: b:311411775

Change-Id: Ie95429ffaf1a977b4af7a5823226daa00b2eca8b

entry.title: WebNN: CoreML: Add support for 0d scalars
entry.content:
This change adds support for input and output operands in the webnn

graph that have no dimensions specified.



In this change we handle this conversion on the server side because

some operators have special meaning for 0d scalars (Gather, ReduceSum)

, additionally some backends like XNNPack accept 0d scalars as is.

Other backends like DML perform this conversion as well.



Bug: 41495248

Change-Id: I95c7abf0c8f4dcb580d3dc21d1a96257dd77b0a7

entry.title: exo: Implement mouse button rewrites within exo
entry.content:
Peripheral customization allows users to remap mouse buttons (ex Middle

click) to arbitrary actions and key combinations. This means a mouse

button could send "KEY_A" and exo/wayland will need to keep track.



This modifies exo::Seat and exo::Keyboard to keep track of physical keys

not by DomCode but by a union of DomCode and CustomizableButton (aka

mouse buttons). This allow exo to keep track of what buttons are

currently held down via mouse button rewrites in addition to keyboard

rewrites.



Filed b/325670284 to track work done to harmonize BTN_EXTRA and BTN_SIDE

across Chrome.



Bug: b/241965717, b/325670284

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Add shadow DOM to embed for PDF Viewer
entry.content:
Add shadow DOM to the outer PDF embed to prevent scripts from accessing

the inner frames of the PDF viewer. Scripts shouldn't be able to access

the implementation details of the PDF viewer using window.frames or the

Document interface. Use a separate HTML page for OOPIF PDF Viewer and

MimeHandlerView to avoid affecting other MIME handlers.



Remove test OopifPdfPostMessageFullPage, as it relied on accessing the

embed. postMessage() cannot be supported for full page PDF with shadow

DOM.



Skip a few existing PDF tests that access the PDF embed, as these would

fail with shadow DOM.

entry.title: exo: Allow multiple rewrites from a single source event
entry.content:
Peripheral customization allows users to remap buttons on their mice or

graphics tablets to multiple "macro" events (ex Ctrl + T).



exo::Seat/exo::Keyboard previously tied rewritten events to a single

source event. This CL allows both of these components to handle multiple

rewritten events from a single physical key press.



To avoid breaking anything unintentionally, the Peripheral Customization

feature is explicitly opted into this functionality via the

`EF_IS_CUSTOMIZED_FROM_BUTTON` flag.

entry.title: [MagicStack] Have destroy() call hide() in Home Modules.
entry.content:
Magic Stack modules implementing ModuleProvider performs cleanup in

hideModule(). Recently it was found that when the NTP is closed,

HomeModulesCoordinator's destroy() gets called, but not hide() (which

calls Mediator's hide(), leading to hideModule()). This can cause

memory and handler leaks, which also affect stability.



This CL fixes the issue by doing the following:

* Having destroy() call hide() in Coordinator.

* In Mediator, early-exit hide() on if Magic Stack is not shown.



Fix: 325641882

Change-Id: I62bf3fad38d12063c180a478fee7710cc67585e3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5304099

Auto-Submit: Samuel Huang

entry.title: DevTools: send original headers in Fetch.requestPaused on redirect
entry.content:
This PR is a follow-up to https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3945615.



* previous header overrides are now reverted before Fetch.requestPaused is sent to the client. Otherwise the client may wrongly see some of the previous headers that will not actually be sent to the server.



* When redirect response is received by the network service, it unconditionally removes "Cookie" header (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/network/url_loader.cc;l=1449;drc=41e2ef2c4bd403419ee390ec9f543238be29f489) as well as some "sec-*" headers (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/network/url_loader.cc;l=1455;drc=41e2ef2c4bd403419ee390ec9f543238be29f489), but the interceptor does not get any notifications about that. To mitigate this problem, this PR mimics the network logic in the interceptor and deletes all those headers from the original request and overridden headers. Due to the dependencies on the network service types in sec_header_helpers.cc (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/network/sec_header_helpers.cc;l=185;drc=41e2ef2c4bd403419ee390ec9f543238be29f489), extracting the logic into a shared place is impractical, so we just delete all the same headers in the interceptor. This may result in more headers being deleted, but that's not an issue since all the actual headers will be reported to the CDP client in Fetch.RequestWillBeSentExtraInfo. We may underreport some headers when paused, but will never report anything that will not be sent.



* Since the header overrides are now reset when redirect is received and before notifying the CDP client, we need to store previous headers to compute new delta when calling FollowRedirect later.



* This PR also fixes the problem in the previous code where in case of 2 redirects the overrides would be reverted to the previous request. Now they are always reverted to the first request in the redirect chain.



Bug: 41490759

Change-Id: I7c5b4de09dae57c0129b2d3f0a2deb3b0baee21f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5294049

Reviewed-by: Dmitry Gozman

Commit-Queue: Yury Semikhatsky

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1261992}

entry.content:
This fixes a regression caused by a recent change where the

`WaylandSurface::set_input_region()` function was updated to take a

vector of rects instead of a single rect.



Ensure an empty input region is still set by passing a single-element

vector with an empty rect instead of an empty vector, for it to behave

same as before the change where an empty rect was passed.



The regular wayland tab-drag bug is fixed by the the fix in subsurface.

entry.title: Add helper class for waiting browser to be set as last active one.
entry.content:
Currently, when Lacros ui code opens a browser window or switch a

different browser window, the BrowserList::SetLastActive() is

called to set the browser window to the last active one.

However, this function is called twice every time such UI update

happens. It is first called synchronously from Lacros when Lacros requests the UI update; and later it is called again asynchronously

when Wayland notifies Lacros about UI change. If the UI code is

switching between different browsers quickly, there could be a

race due to the async update of BrowserList::SetLastActive(),

which can lead to some potential issue to mess up the last active

browser state in Lacros side. This happens in some test cases, since

the tests ported from ash assume only the sychronous update

of BrowserList::SetLastActive(). Now these tests are flaky in Lacros.



Please see more detail in b/325634285 and an example

for the related test flaky/failure issue in b/40948433.



This cl adds a helper class, so that test code can be prepared

to handle the asynchronous update for the last active browser.



Eventually, we will change the production code to make

Lacros update the last active browser completely asynchrously,

but that will break a lot of existing tests. Therefore,

we will implement it incrementally by preparing the tests

to handle async BrowserList::SetLastActive() from wayland UI

update first.



Although the waiting in test can not completely fix test flakiness

until we making the production code change mentioned above,

this reduce the flakiness to a large extent.

HostedOrWebAppTest.CtrlClickLink can be enabled now(failed

most times without this cl), the tests are still a little

flaky (HostedApp variant failed 2 of 24),

but passed Flake Endorser.



Bug: b:40948433, b:325634285

Change-Id: Id50097eb6b99e4ec3d5f12dfdb92a7b56ee83e76

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5303255

Commit-Queue: Jenny Zhang

entry.content:

when opening a document PiP window were incorrectly used to set the

outer dimensions of the window. They're supposed to refer to the

inner size.



This CL adjusts for the chrome- and platform-provided non-client

areas to choose a window size that provides the requested innner

size instead. It also adds a test for this behavior.

entry.title: [Benefits][Settings] Shows card benefits toggle if benefits are present
entry.content:
The payment settings page displays the 'Card benefits' toggle when

card benefits are available and the kAutofillEnableCardBenefits flag is

enabled. The toggle is disabled when the autofill credit card toggle is

disabled. The toggle also has a sublabel with a 'Learn about card

benefits' link that opens the Google Pay help page in a new tab.

This placeholder will be replaced with the relevant article link upon

completion.



The upcoming CL will include an event handler for the benefits toggle

switch and ensure the 'Learn about card benefits' link points to the

correct article.

want to send a CSBRR whenever users accept notifications permissions for

a site after bypassing an interstitial warning. See

ChromeOS. The bug b/325636200 will track the progress of this.

entry.title: documentScan: Add time limit for discovery sessions
entry.content:
When using the original synchronous ListScanners function, Chrome could

detect a lorgnette crash or hang because the d-bus call would eventually

fail. With the new synchronous discovery sessions, the only symptom of

a problem with lorgnette is that session signals never arrive. In order

to avoid waiting for a response indefinitely, add an activity timer that

runs when any discovery session is active.



Each time the timer fires, OnDiscoveryMonitor checks each of the active

sessions to see how long has passed since the last signal. If more than

20s has passed without any activity, it assumes lorgnette has crashed or

hung; sessions in this state are terminated by injecting a synthetic

SESSION_ENDING signal.



Note that the overall session can still last more than 20s as long as

lorgnette continues returning intermediate results. In testing, the

real interval between updates is never more than a few seconds, so 20s

should be enough to ensure this doesn't catch mere slow enumerations.

This also adds new metrics so we can tune the specific timeout in the

future.



Bug: b/277049005

entry.title: [views-a11y] Fire text selection changed event after focus in Textfield
entry.content:
The kTextSelectionChanged event fired in Textfield::OnCaretBoundsChanged is fired before the kFocus event is

fired in the View::Focus function.



Some screen readers expect to be notified of the focus change before they get notified about the text selection change. When they receive a text selected changed event before the focus one, they simply ignore it and don't act on it.



This CL fixes this bug by adding the Textfield as a ViewObserver

that listens for the OnViewFocused completion callback. We'll delay

firing the kTextSelectionChanged event when we notice the accessible

focus event hasn't been fired yet, and only fire the selection change

event after.



This CL also slightly upgrade the TextfieldTest infrastructure to

support more extensive accessible events testing.



Fixed: 40947297

Change-Id: I272efdc86b6193cd016814937a42a72ab51a8c6b

entry.title: Prepare for anchor position adjustment with sticky and anchored containers
entry.content:
We will also consider offsets of sticky and anchored containers when

calculating the scroll adjustments of anchor positioned elements. As

the adjustments will be not only scroll offsets from scroll

containers, this CL renames:

- cc::AnchorPositionScrollersData to cc::AnchorPositionScrollData

because it's not only for scrollers ("Scroll" is still kept because

the data is still about scroll adjustment),

- scroll_container_ids to adjustment_container_ids,

- accumulated_scroll_offset to accumulated_offset.



Also refactor AnchorPositionScrollData::TakeAndCompareSnapshot by

extracting ComputeDefaultAnchorAdjustmentData() and

ComputeAdditionalBoundsOffset() which can be called in a later CL to

get the offsets of chained anchored containers.

entry.title: [omnibox] Update ShouldRunProvider() to fix custom searches not working.
entry.content:
Currently ShouldRunProvider() returns true in keyword mode for any

provider that isn't explicitly deny-listed. OpenTabProvider should

only be run for the @tabs keyword or the CrOS launcher, but we

return too early to check for that.



OpenTabProvider has high relevance scores, resulting in the open tab

suggestion out-ranking the keyword provider, kicking the user out of

keyword mode. This CL updates the default behavior to continue to the

open tab check rather than returning true.



Bug: 324937417

entry.title: [Benefits] Render benefit text in Autofill suggestions.
entry.content:
This CL implements Autofill suggestions with benefits shown as a new suggestion label.



Benefits are only shown to desktop users with app-locale US English and only on fields labeled CREDIT_CARD_NUMBER. Benefits are also ranked as follows: merchant benefits, category benefits, and flat rate benefits.



For category benefits, the ASG makes a call to the optimization guide to check if there is an available benefit category optimization based on the url and issuer of the credit card. A true return results in a DB check for the category suggestion text to render. Merchant and flat rate benefits are directly pulled from Autofill DB.



Summary of changes:

1. AutofillOptimizationGuide: Optimization guide check for category optimization

2. AutofillSuggestionGenerator: GetCreditCardBenefitToDisplay with internal ranking of benefits. AdjustVirtualCardSuggestionContent update to show VCN label and benefit text together.



Mock: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4EmsTDeZyVzhnrZ.png

Implementation screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BcCakRB2GyNaQhc.png



go/pay-autofill-chrome-benefits-design

entry.title: Remove base_feature: "none" from runtime_enabled_features.json5 batch 1
entry.content:
This batch removes base_feature: "none" for the blink runtime features

that meet all following conditions:

- No "public: true",

- No "origin_trial_feature_name",

- The name string (quotes included) doesn't appear in any c++ files,

which means:

1. The same feature name is not used by any base feature;

2. The feature name is not used in content/child/runtime_features.cc

to associate the feature with command line switches or base

features.



Reasons:

1. We can have finch-controlled killswitch for these features;

2. --enable-features/--disable-features can enable/disable

these blink runtime features.

3. Reduce non-good examples for new features. I see some recently-added

features have base_feature: "none", probably just copied from the

existing features.

entry.title: IDB: move LevelDBFactory from singleton to per-bucket instance.
entry.content:
LevelDBFactory holds onto state and configuration for Level DB,

mainly via an instance of LevelDBOptions. LevelDBOptions in turn

points to a number of singletons, as well as holding some POD

options.



Since the important underlying state is still just pointers to

singletons, changing LevelDBFactory use from singleton to various

instances should not have any impact on its own.



However, the existence of the underlying/shared configuration

objects will necessitate great care when attempting to split

level db instances across sequences.



As a result of this CL, IndexedDBClassFactory is finally whittled

down to nothingness.



Bug: 40279485

entry.title: Merge compat checking logic to allow for both layout and new field
entry.content:
This allows newer version to both migrate to nullable primitives and

adding new fields.



If an non-backwards compatible nullable type change is attemped, for

example:



struct S {

int32 x;

bool has_x;

};



to



struct S {

int32? x;

}; // not compatible because ordinal values are wrong.



The following error message will be emitted:



"Struct S field with ordinal value 0 have different type or min

version, old name x, new name x"



This is because nullable values are converted to:



bool x; // internal id is different

int32 x;



which means that the types at ordinal field @0 are mismatched bewtween

bool vs. int32.



Bug: 657632

Change-Id: I494c6d37a2a63291e224c856065f1956c2f3d438

entry.title: gpu: Fail EstablishGpuChannel if GPU process returns invalid mojo handle
entry.content:
GpuClient::OnEstablishGpuChannel has a DCHECK that asserts that if the

status is kSuccess, the channel mojo handle must also be valid. However,

there's nothing that really guarantees this - GpuServiceImpl can return

an empty handle for transient errors and GpuHostImpl will just pass that

along to GpuClient with a kSuccess status. This CL makes it so that

GpuHostImpl passes a kGpuHostInvalid status if the handle is invalid,

which should make the client retry establishing a GPU channel.



Bug: 40073631

notification is received before the notification handler is initialized.

entry.title: [Blink] Optimize additions of options to <select>
entry.content:
Addition of N options to a with size

greater than 1, it has no effect on the selected state as per the HTML

spec. This change ensures that we do not call ResetToDefaultSelection()

in that case.



Addition of 25,000 options takes ~400ms after this change (which took

~12s earlier).



HTML spec: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-elements.html#selectedness-setting-algorithm

Test page: https://jsbin.com/muwacasuwe/edit?html,js,output

entry.title: [Tab Group] TabModelJniBridge#hasOtherRelatedTabs -> isTabInTabGroup
entry.content:
In the effort of supporting tab groups with a single tab we are

migrating from hasOtherRelatedTabs to isTabInTabGroup.

hasOtherRelatedTabs does not make sense for tab groups with a single

tab. This CL migrates TabModelJniBridge and related places.



Until the flag for the migration AndroidTabGroupStableIds is enabled

isTabInTabGroup has the same meaning as hasOtherRelatedTabs. Once

enabled isTabInTabGroup checks for the presence of the new stable

tab group ID only assigned to "real" tab groups as opposed to

hasOtherRelatedTabs which checked if the group contained at least

two tabs.



Bug: b/41496693

entry.content:
MockFailureInjector is a mojom interface used by browser tests to

simulate backing store failures. In this CL, the LevelDB specific

version is changed from a singleton on the main IDB sequence to an

instance on the bucket sequence because:



a) it needs to be accessed from the bucket sequence (only)

b) IndexedDBContextImpl shouldn't know about level DB

c) singletons are bad, even though they do save on plumbing

entry.title: desk_profiles: crosapi changes to pass profile id when loading favicons
entry.content:
In the ChromeOS saved desk library, favicons are shown for saved desks

that contain browsers (which would be most of them). The favicons are

currently loaded using the "active" profile, which doesn't work well for

the simple reason that the profile might not have visited the site.



This CL contains the crosapi changes to allow ash to pass a lacros

profile ID over to lacros. The lacros-side changes are complete. The ash

side changes are minimal and only enough to compile. The actual ash side

changes to pass profile IDs will be in an upcoming CL.



BUG=b:322847219



Change-Id: I7258ad26bd4eb6468153782517960aca852bb64c

entry.title: 'writingsuggestions' content attribute should reflect the given value
entry.content:
In CL:5247315, we set the content attribute to values 'true'/'false'

during the IDL setter. However, it was raised in spec dicussions that

the content attribute should just reflect the value set by the IDL

setter to match the default reflection logic of enumerated attributes.



E.g. when setting element.writingSuggestions = "invalid-value"



Previously:

getAttribute("writingsuggestions") == "true"



Now:

getAttribute("writingsuggestions") == "invalid-value"



Bug: 1513953

Change-Id: Iebb008de9cda661509bab6cfe1ffa97566986639

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5297548

Reviewed-by: Dan Clark

entry.title: Fix renderer crash on opening FileSettings du to oracle mismatch
entry.content:
Due to a oracle mismatch between here [1] and here [2], the mojo pipe

is created on one side which is not matched on the other. This CL keeps

them in sync.



Bug: b/324579786



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_browser_interface_binders.cc;l=1661;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/ash/settings/pages/files/files_section.cc;l=270;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa
